Description: Chevron Phillips Chemical Company agreed to pay a $1.8 civil penalty for Clean Air Act violations that led to two explosions and releases of chemicals into the air from a chemical manufacturing plant in Pasadena, Texas in 1999 and 2000. The company also agreed to spend $1.2 million on two supplementary environmental projects.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned 50-50 by Phillips 66 and Chevron)
joint venture (owned 50-50 by Phillips 66 and Chevron)
Notes: Chevron Phillips Chemical is a 50-50 joint venture of Phillips 66 and Chevron.

Description: Chevron Phillips agreed to pay $2 million and make changes to its operations in Baytown, Texas to resolve a Clean Air Act case brought by Environment Texas and the Sierra Club.
